_label: Portrait of Sir Anthony Mildmay, Knight of Apethorpe, Northants

identified_by.content: Portrait of Sir Anthony Mildmay, Knight of Apethorpe, Northants

referred_to_by.content:
Sir Anthony Mildmay, Knight of Apethorpe
 [c. 1549-1617] Northants, England by descent to his daughter, Mary, Countess of Westmoreland (née Mildmay) (1590/9 ?-1617); Mary, Countess of Westmoreland [1593?-1640] Northhamshire, England, by descent to her son, Sir Francis Fane (1617-1640); Sir Frances Fane [1611-1681], Fulbeck, Lincolnshire, England by descent to his son Sir Francis Fane (1640-1681); Sir Francis Fane [d. 1691], Henbury, Gloucestershire, England by descent to his son Henry Fane (1681-1691); Henry Fane [1669-1726], Brympton, Yeovil, Somerset, England by descent to his son, Henry Fane (1691-1726); Henry Fane [1703-1777], Wormsley, Oxfordshire, England by descent to his daughter, Mary Stapelton (née Fane) (1726-1777); Mary Stapleton (née Fane)  [c.1744-1835], Oxfordshire) by descent to her grandson, Rev. Hon. Sir Francis Jarvis Stapleton (1777-1835); Rev. Hon. Sir Francis Jarvis Stapleton [1807-1874], 7th Bt. Mereworth Rectory, Kent, England by descent to his son, Richard Talbot Plantagenet Stapleton (1835-1874); Richard Talbot Plantagenet Stapleton [1834-1899], Grey’s Court, Oxfordshire, England by descent to his son, Sir Miles Talbot Stapleton (1874-1899); Sir Miles Stapleton, Bart of Greys, [1893-1977], Henley-on-Thames, United Kingdom consigned to Christie's London for sale (1899-1926); (Christie’s, London, United Kingdom, May 11, 1926, lot 79 sold to S.J. Phillips for 510 gns.) (1926); (S.J. Phillips, London, United Kingdom, sold to                                                                      
 Durlacher Brothers) (1926); (Durlacher Brothers, New York, NY sold to the Cleveland Museum of Art) (1926); The Cleveland Museum of Art, Cleveland, OH (1926-)
